birth_place.zh-cn: 中华民国山东省齐河县赵官镇大胡庄
birth_place.en: Dahuzhuang, Zhaoguan Town, Qihe County, Shandong Province, Republic of China

death_place.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国北京市

description.zh-cn: 中国劳动模范，曾任清洁工。因提出“宁愿一人脏，换来万人净”的口号而闻名，在文化大革命期间因与刘少奇的联系而遭受迫害，后被平反。
description.en: A Chinese model worker who worked as a sanitation worker. He was famous for the slogan 'Better one person is dirty, in exchange for ten thousand people's cleanliness.' He was persecuted during the Cultural Revolution due to his connection with Liu Shaoqi and was later rehabilitated.

description.zh-cn: 中国山东省德州市下辖县，是时传祥的出生地。
description.en: A county under the administration of Dezhou City, Shandong Province, China, and the birthplace of Shi Chuanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的首都，是时传祥长期工作和逝世的地点。
description.en: The capital of the People's Republic of China, where Shi Chuanxiang worked for a long time and passed away.

description.zh-cn: 时传祥于1952年加入的北京市环卫组织。
description.en: The sanitation organization in Beijing that Shi Chuanxiang joined in 1952.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The founding and ruling political party of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中国人民政治协商会议北京市委员会

zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议北京市委员会
en: Beijing Municipal Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference

description.zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议在北京市的地方组织。
description.en: The local organization of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国授予劳动者的最高荣誉称号，时传祥于1959年获得此称号。
description.en: The highest honorary title for laborers in the People's Republic of China, which Shi Chuanxiang received in 1959.

description.zh-cn: 中国马克思主义理论家、政治家、革命家，曾任中华人民共和国主席。在文化大革命中被迫害致死。
description.en: A Chinese Marxist theorist, politician, and revolutionary who served as the Chairman of the People's Republic of China. He was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的机关报。
description.en: The official newspaper of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，曾任北京市副市长、国务院副总理、全国人大常委会委员长。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as Vice Mayor of Beijing, Vice Premier of the State Council, and Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，曾任北京市副市长、中华人民共和国卫生部部长。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as Vice Mayor of Beijing and Minister of Health of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国第三届全国人民代表大会

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国第三届全国人民代表大会
en: 3rd National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的最高国家权力机关的第三届会议，时传祥曾当选为该届代表。
description.en: The third session of the highest state authority of the People's Republic of China, to which Shi Chuanxiang was elected as a deputy.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、战略家、理论家，中国共产党、中国人民解放军和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, strategist, and theorist, who was the main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Liberation Army, and the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家、军事家、外交家，中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: A Chinese politician, military leader, and diplomat who was a major leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, and served as the Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国历史上的一场政治运动，对时传祥等众多人物造成了严重迫害。
description.en: A political movement in the history of the People's Republic of China that caused severe persecution to many individuals, including Shi Chuanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 时传祥的妻子。
description.en: Wife of Shi Chuanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 时传祥的长子，曾为北京市使馆清洁运输处工人。
description.en: The eldest son of Shi Chuanxiang, who worked as a worker at the Beijing Embassy Cleaning and Transportation Department.

description.zh-cn: 时传祥的子女，曾是崇文区环卫局三队工人。
description.en: A child of Shi Chuanxiang, who was a worker in the Third Team of the Chongwen District Environmental Sanitation Bureau.

description.zh-cn: 时传祥的子女，曾担任北京市使馆清洁队垃圾分拣工。
description.en: A child of Shi Chuanxiang, who worked as a garbage sorter for the Beijing Embassy Cleaning Team.

description.zh-cn: 时传祥的子女，曾是第一清洁车辆厂统计员。
description.en: A child of Shi Chuanxiang, who was a statistician at the First Cleaning Vehicle Factory.

description.zh-cn: 时传祥出生于山东省齐河县赵官镇大胡庄。
description.en: Shi Chuanxiang was born in Dahuzhuang, Zhaoguan Town, Qihe County, Shandong Province.

relationships.target: 中国人民政治协商会议北京市委员会

description.zh-cn: 时任国家主席刘少奇在人民大会堂接见并与时传祥握手，称赞其工作，表示“你掏大粪是人民勤务员，我当主席也是人民勤务员，这只是革命分工不同。”此次接见极大地提升了时传祥的社会地位和声望。
description.en: Then-State Chairman Liu Shaoqi met with and shook hands with Shi Chuanxiang at the Great Hall of the People, praising his work by saying, 'You are a servant of the people for collecting night soil, and I am a servant of the people as the chairman; it's just a different division of labor in the revolution.' This meeting greatly enhanced Shi Chuanxiang's social status and prestige.

description.zh-cn: 刊登了刘少奇与时传祥的合影，扩大了时传祥在全国的知名度。
description.en: Published a photo of Liu Shaoqi and Shi Chuanxiang, which increased Shi Chuanxiang's national fame.

description.zh-cn: 时任北京市副市长的万里到“时传祥班”参加劳动，并自称是时传祥的“第一大弟子”。
description.en: Wan Li, then Vice Mayor of Beijing, participated in labor with the 'Shi Chuanxiang Team' and called himself Shi Chuanxiang's 'first major disciple'.

description.zh-cn: 与时任北京市副市长万里一同到“时传祥班”参加劳动。
description.en: Participated in labor with the 'Shi Chuanxiang Team' along with then-Vice Mayor of Beijing, Wan Li.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国第三届全国人民代表大会

description.zh-cn: 在1966年国庆观礼上，时传祥作为北京市观礼团副团长受到毛泽东的接见。
description.en: At the 1966 National Day ceremony, Shi Chuanxiang, as the deputy head of the Beijing delegation, was received by Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 在1966年国庆招待宴会上，周恩来向时传祥敬酒。
description.en: At the 1966 National Day reception banquet, Zhou Enlai toasted Shi Chuanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，因与刘少奇的联系，时传祥受到牵连，被打成“工贼”、“粪霸”，遭到揪斗，并于1971年被遣送回原籍，直到1973年8月才被平反。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, due to his connection with Liu Shaoqi, Shi Chuanxiang was implicated, labeled a 'scab' and 'manure tyrant,' subjected to struggle sessions, and sent back to his hometown in 1971. He was not politically rehabilitated until August 1973.

description.zh-cn: 得知时传祥的遭遇后，指示有关部门将其接回北京，并为其政治平反，恢复名誉。
description.en: After learning about Shi Chuanxiang's situation, he instructed relevant departments to bring him back to Beijing, politically rehabilitate him, and restore his reputation.

description.zh-cn: 得知时传祥的遭遇后，与毛泽东一同指示有关部门将其接回北京，并为其政治平反，恢复名誉。
description.en: After learning about Shi Chuanxiang's situation, along with Mao Zedong, he instructed relevant departments to bring him back to Beijing, politically rehabilitate him, and restore his reputation.
